noot.test
Class CompilerTest

java.lang.Object
  noot.test.CompilerTest

public class CompilerTest
extends Object

The Class CompilerTest. We can use JUnit to test our compiler using this class.

public CompilerTest()
Method Detail

testCorrectExpressions

public void testCorrectExpressions()
Test standard expressions. Testing several expressions and their evaluation levels.

testCorrectCompoundExpressions

public void testCorrectCompoundExpressions()
Test compound expressions. Testing several compound expressions. Some with nested return.

testCorrectReadPrint

public void testCorrectReadPrint()
Test the read and print statements. Testing several constructions of correct read and print statments. Also in combination with the assign statements.

testCorrectAssignments

public void testCorrectAssignments()
Test assignments. Testing several assign statements.

testCorrectIfElse

public void testCorrectIfElse()
Test if and else statements. Testing several if and else statement variants. With and without return and assign.

testCorrectWhile

public void testCorrectWhile()
Test while statement. Testing a simple while loop.

testIncorrectAssignment1

public void testIncorrectAssignment1()
Test incorrect assignment1. Tries to assign with the wrong type. This should fail.

testIncorrectAssignment2

public void testIncorrectAssignment2()
Test incorrect assignment2. Tries to assign a constant. This should fail.

testIncorrectCompoundExpressions

public void testIncorrectCompoundExpressions()
Test incorrect compound expressions. Declaration typed as last argument in a compound expression this is not allowed and the program should fail.

testIncorrectDeclarationScope

public void testIncorrectDeclarationScope()
Test incorrect declaration scope. Tries to declare an identifier that has already been declared in the current scope.

testIncorrectIdentifier

public void testIncorrectIdentifier()
Test incorrect identifier. Tries to assign an identifier that has not been declared.

testIncorrectIfElse1

public void testIncorrectIfElse1()
Test incorrect if else1. Tries to assign an if statement with int as return to a boolean. This should fail.

testIncorrectIfElse2

public void testIncorrectIfElse2()
Test incorrect if else2. Tries to assign a variable with the result of an if statement with different types. The else has an int as type and the if has an char as type. Since the types are different the statement results as void and a void can't be assigned.

testIncorrectIfElse3

public void testIncorrectIfElse3()
Test incorrect if else3. Tries to assign a variable with the result of an if statement without else. This should not work since the type of an if statement without else is void.

testIncorrectReadPrint1

public void testIncorrectReadPrint1()
Test incorrect read print1. Tries to read a constant, this should not be allowed.

testIncorrectReadPrint2

public void testIncorrectReadPrint2()
Test incorrect read print2. Tries to enter a void argument into print. This should not be allowed.

testIncorrectType1

public void testIncorrectType1()
Test incorrect type1. Tries to enter an int into the && operator. This should not be allowed since the && operator should only except bools.

testIncorrectType2

public void testIncorrectType2()
Test incorrect type2. Tries to enter a bool into the > operator. This should not be allowed since the > operator should only except ints;

testIncorrectSpelling1

public void testIncorrectSpelling1()
Test incorrect spelling. This will generate a lexing error because a token is not spelled correctly (=).

testIncorrectSpelling2

public void testIncorrectSpelling2()
Test incorrect spelling. This will generate a parsing error because an token is missing, namely the } token.

testIncorrectRuntime

public void testIncorrectRuntime()
Test incorrect at runtime. This will halt the program because of devide by zero.

testFile

private boolean testFile(String inputFile,
                         String expectedOutput,
                         String input)
Help function to be used by the test methods. It calls the compiler and intercepts the print to the system out. Than it compares the actual result of the program with the expected result. Use the input parameter for input to for example the read() statement.

Parameters:
inputFile - the input file
expectedOutput - the expected output, use \n for line breaks
input - the input
Returns:
true, if successful
